Welcome to Contacts project’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Health check endpoint to verify the database connection.

Parameters:

db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

Raises:

HTTPException – If there’s an error connecting to the database.

Returns:

A message indicating the status of the health check.

Return type:

dict

main.index()¶

Root endpoint to check if the application is running.

async main.startup()¶

Startup event handler for initializing Redis connection.

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Creates a new contact for the user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – Data of the new contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object.

  • user (User) – User object for whom the contact is being created.

Returns:

Created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Deletes a contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object.

  • user (User) – User object for whom the contact is being deleted.

Returns:

Deleted contact or None if contact is not found.

Return type:

Optional[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Returns a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object.

  • user (User) – User object for whom contacts with upcoming birthdays are being fetched.

Returns:

List of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Returns a contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to search for.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object.

  • user (User) – User object for whom the contact is being searched.

Returns:

Contact object or None if contact is not found.

Return type:

Optional[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.read_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

Returns a list of user contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to return.

  • offset (int) – Result offset for pagination tracking.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object.

  • user (User) – User object for whom contacts are being fetched.

Returns:

List of user contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Updates an existing contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactUpdateSchema) – Data for updating the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object.

  • user (User) – User object for whom the contact is being updated.

Returns:

Updated contact or None if contact is not found.

Return type:

Optional[Contact]

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

Mark a user’s email as confirmed.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object.

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Create a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserSchema) – Data of the new user.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

Returns:

The newly created user object.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieve a user by their email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to retrieve.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

Returns:

The user object corresponding to the given email, or None if no user found.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

Update the avatar URL of a user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • url (str, optional) – The new avatar URL.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object.

Returns:

The updated user object.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

Update the refresh token of a user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user object to update.

  • token (str, optional) – The new refresh token value.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session object.

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create a new contact.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – Data for the new contact.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

  • user (User) – Current user.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Delete a contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

  • user (User) – Current user.

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a single contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

  • user (User) – Current user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If contact is not found.

Returns:

The contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to return (default 10, max 500).

  • offset (int) – Number of contacts to skip (default 0).

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

  • user (User) – Current user.

Returns:

List of contacts.

Return type:

list[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdateSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update an existing contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact.

  • body (ContactUpdateSchema) – Data to update the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

  • user (User) – Current user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If contact is not found.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirm email address.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Email confirmation token.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

Raises:

HTTPException – If verification error or email already confirmed.

Returns:

Confirmation message.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Log in a user.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm containing username (email) and password.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

Raises:

HTTPException – If invalid email or password, or email not confirmed.

Returns:

Access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenSchema

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh access token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials containing refresh token.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

Raises:

HTTPException – If invalid refresh token.

Returns:

New access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenSchema

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Request email confirmation.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – RequestEmail object containing email address.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – BackgroundTasks object to handle background tasks.

  • request (Request) – FastAPI Request object.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

Raises:

HTTPException – If email already confirmed.

Returns:

Confirmation message.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Sign up a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserSchema) – Data of the new user.

  • bt (BackgroundTasks) – BackgroundTasks object to handle background tasks.

  • request (Request) – FastAPI Request object.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

Raises:

HTTPException – If account already exists.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

UserResponse

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
async src.routes.users.update_user_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Update user’s avatar.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The image file to upload.

  • user (User) – Current user.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

Returns:

Updated user with avatar URL.

Return type:

UserResponse

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

Class for handling authentication operations.

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '1234567890'¶
cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create an access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float], optional) – Expiry delta in seconds, defaults to None.

Returns:

The access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Create an email verification token.

Parameters:

data (dict) – Data to encode in the token.

Returns:

The email verification token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create a refresh token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float], optional) – Expiry delta in seconds, defaults to None.

Returns:

The refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decode a refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The refresh token to decode.

Returns:

The decoded email.

Return type:

str

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Get the current user from the token.

Parameters:

  • token (str, optional) – The JWT token.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – Database session object.

Returns:

The current user.

Return type:

User

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Get the email from an email verification token.

Parameters:

token (str) – The email verification token.

Returns:

The email decoded from the token.

Return type:

str

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Generate a hashed password.

Parameters:

password (str) – The password to hash.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verify the plain password against the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain text password.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password.

Returns:

True if passwords match, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Send an email for email verification.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The email address of the recipient.

  • username (str) – The username of the recipient.

  • host (str) – The host URL.
